Root Cause: Bug due to feeding a nonscalar num_bits input tensor to QuantizeAndDequantizeV3 API, which results in a CHECK fail that can be used to trigger a denial of service attack.
Bug due to receiving input min or max that is nonscalar
Bug due to feeding very large input shape and rates
Bug due to feeding very large input shape and rates
Bug due to feeding a nonscalar input to the id argument, which triggers a CHECK fail and can lead to a denial of service attack.
Bug due to feeding non-float input to DrawBoundingBoxes API
Bug due to feeding an incorrect Tout input to Eig API, which triggers a CHECK fail and can lead to a denial of service attack.
Bug due to feeding empty tensor as input to out_backprop argument
Bug due to passing an input element_shape with more than one dimension to EmptyTensorList API
Bug due to feeding a non-scalar input separator to tf.sparse.cross API.
Bug due to feeding empty input to Conv2D API, which causes division-by-zero floating point exceptions.
Bug due to feeding sample_rate argument with more than one element
Bug due to feeding a scalar input to CollectiveGather API, which expects a tensor input.
Bug due to feeding a non-1D tensor to the set_shape argument of SetSize API, which triggers a CHECK fail and can be used to trigger a denial of service attack.
Bug due to receiving an element_shape of a rank greater than one
Bug due to passing an element_shape of a rank greater than one to TensorListScatter and TensorListScatterV2 APIs, which triggers a CHECK fail and can lead to a denial of service attack.
Bug due to passing an element_shape of a rank greater than one to TensorListScatter and TensorListScatterV2 APIs, which triggers a CHECK fail and can lead to a denial of service attack.

Bug due to passing input min or max of rank other than 1 to tf.quantization.fake_quant_with_min_max_vars_per_channel_gradient API, which triggers a CHECK fail that can lead to a denial of service attack.
Bug due to providing a window size input array ksize with dimensions greater than its input tensor input
Bug due to feeding an empty input to tf.linalg.matrix_rank API

Bug due to DenseBincount assuming its input tensor weights to either have the same shape as its input tensor input or to be length-0. A different weights shape will trigger a CHECK fail that can be used to trigger a denial of service attack.
Bug due to feeding an empty input tensor to RaggedBincount API
Bug due to providing an output_image input tensor that is not 4-D
Bug due to passing a shape of type int64 instead of int32
Bug due to feeding tensors of an unsupported dtype to Save or SaveSlices API
Bug due to feeding tensors of an unsupported dtype to Save or SaveSlices API
Bug due to feeding inputs for indices, values, and dense_shape that do not make a valid sparse tensor, resulting in a segfault that can be used to trigger a denial of service attack.

Bug due to incorrectly sized inputs, which triggers a CHECK failure in FractionalMaxPoolGrad API
Bug due to feeding nonscalar inputs for min_features or max_features
Bug due to feeding nonscalar inputs for min_features or max_features
Bug due to feeding empty tensor to input_min argument
Bug due to feeding nonscalar input to QuantizedMatMul API
Bug due to feeding min or max tensors of a rank other than one to FakeQuantWithMinMaxVarsPerChannel API, which results in a CHECK fail that can be used to trigger a denial of service attack.
Bug due to passing empty tensors for min_input and max_input, and tensors of rank greater than 1 for min_bias and max_bias arguments, which results in a segmentation fault.
